alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 320 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles southwest of Ramon, or 24 miles southeast of Corona, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Lincoln County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
